articles.headline: Japan’s Nuclear Energy Industry Nears Shutdown, at Least for Now
articles.snippet: All but two of Japan’s 54 commercial reactors have been idled since the nuclear disaster a year ago, following the earthquake and tsunami, and it is not clear when they can be restarted.
articles.abstract: All but two of Japan’s 54 commercial reactors have been idled since the nuclear disaster a year ago, following the earthquake and tsunami, and it is not clear when they can be restarted.
articles.lead_paragraph: OHI, Japan — All but two of Japan’s 54 commercial reactors have gone offline since the nuclear disaster a year ago, after the earthquake and tsunami, and it is not clear when they can be restarted. With the last operating reactor scheduled to be idled as soon as next month, Japan — once one of the world’s leaders in atomic energy — will have at least temporarily shut down an industry that once generated a third of its electricity.

articles.headline: An Industry’s Failure to Verify, After Trusting
articles.snippet: A pending civil suit against MBIA, an insurer of mortgage-backed securities, may illuminate the misbehavior of the financial industry before and during the downturn.
articles.abstract: A pending civil suit against MBIA, an insurer of mortgage-backed securities, may illuminate the misbehavior of the financial industry before and during the downturn.
articles.lead_paragraph: As the financial crisis intensified in mid-2008, the largest of the monoline insurance companies that had guaranteed payments on complicated securities retained an investment bank to evaluate the risks it had taken on in a small part of its portfolio — a group of 15 collateralized debt obligations.

articles.headline: Spanish-Language TV Dramas Heat Up Miami
articles.snippet: Incentives, safety and the inexpensive sets as a result of the housing crisis have shifted productions of Spanish-language soap operas from Mexico to Miami.
articles.abstract: Incentives, safety and the inexpensive sets as a result of the housing crisis have shifted productions of Spanish-language soap operas from Mexico to Miami.
articles.lead_paragraph: MIAMI — Blanca Soto moved to Los Angeles from Mexico to make a better life. After a decade of struggling there, she relocated to Miami where she works 10-hour days, six days a week.

articles.headline: New Apps Connect to Friends Nearby
articles.snippet: Apps that let users find friends whenever they are nearby are to be on display at the South by Southwest technology, music and film conference.
articles.abstract: Apps that let users find friends whenever they are nearby are to be on display at the South by Southwest technology, music and film conference.
articles.lead_paragraph: Smartphones have become indispensable for some people to find nearby cool new places for a bite or a drink.

articles.headline: As Stars Rally for Candidate, Rival Objects
articles.snippet: Elizabeth Warren has drawn support for her Massachusetts Senate campaign from all over the country, a fact her opponent is trying to use against her.
articles.abstract: Elizabeth Warren has drawn support for her Massachusetts Senate campaign from all over the country, a fact her opponent is trying to use against her.
articles.lead_paragraph: BOSTON — Elizabeth Warren may be running for the United States Senate in Massachusetts, but her campaign is getting deep support 3,000 miles away in California, where the other day, Cher was speaking glowingly of Ms. Warren’s candidacy.

articles.headline: Online, a Distant Conflict Soars to Topic No. 1
articles.snippet: Through social media, Jason Russell did in mere days what diplomats and academics have tried to do for decades: draw attention to the abuses of Joseph Kony and his Lord’s Resistance Army in Uganda.
articles.abstract: Through social media, Jason Russell did in mere days what diplomats and academics have tried to do for decades: draw attention to the abuses of Joseph Kony and his Lord’s Resistance Army in Uganda.
articles.lead_paragraph: KAMPALA, Uganda — Jason Russell said he never knew he was driving into a war zone. At 24, he had just graduated from the University of Southern California after studying film, he said, and was out looking for a story to tell.
articles.byline: By Josh Kron and J. David Goodman

articles.headline: Hacker, Informant and Party Boy of the Projects
articles.snippet: On the Internet he was Sabu, a notorious celebrity who led a scattered tribe of politically motivated “hacktivists.” Then he slipped into the role of federal informant.
articles.abstract: On the Internet he was Sabu, a notorious celebrity who led a scattered tribe of politically motivated “hacktivists.” Then he slipped into the role of federal informant.
articles.lead_paragraph: In his Lower East Side apartment, the nights were racket-filled and without end. Neighbors lived with the pounding music and the sound of a pit bull being chased around the living room. The revelry sent scores of calls to the city’s complaint line.
articles.byline: By N. R. Kleinfield and Somini Sengupta

articles.headline: Bank of America Reaches Deal on Housing
articles.snippet: The bank will provide deeper-than-anticipated principal reductions for 200,000 homeowners under newly-disclosed terms of a foreclosure settlement with authorities.
articles.abstract: The bank will provide deeper-than-anticipated principal reductions for 200,000 homeowners under newly-disclosed terms of a foreclosure settlement with authorities.
articles.lead_paragraph: Bank of America will provide deeper-than-anticipated principal reductions for about 200,000 homeowners under newly-disclosed terms of last month’s foreclosure settlement with state and federal authorities.

articles.headline: Next Time, Greece May Need New Tactics
articles.snippet: If the country confronts a new cash crunch in coming years, as many expect, it will not be able to use strong-arm tactics to force losses on its bondholders.
articles.abstract: If the country confronts a new cash crunch in coming years, as many expect, it will not be able to use strong-arm tactics to force losses on its bondholders.

articles.headline: White House Works to Shape Debate Over Health Law
articles.snippet: The Obama administration has begun an aggressive campaign to use approaching Supreme Court arguments on the new health care law as a moment to build support for the measure.
articles.abstract: The Obama administration has begun an aggressive campaign to use approaching Supreme Court arguments on the new health care law as a moment to build support for the measure.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The White House has begun an aggressive campaign to use approaching Supreme Court arguments on the new health care law as a moment to build support for the measure seen as President Obama’s signature legislative achievement, hoping to shape public opinion on an issue at the center of the battle for the White House and Congress.

articles.headline: U.S. Extends Its Run of Strong Job Growth Another Month
articles.snippet: The United States added 227,000 jobs in February, the third straight month of gains over 200,000, while the unemployment rate stayed at 8.3 percent, the Labor Department reported.
articles.abstract: The United States added 227,000 jobs in February, the third straight month of gains over 200,000, while the unemployment rate stayed at 8.3 percent, the Labor Department reported.
articles.lead_paragraph: After a stretch of economic expansion so weak that Main Street struggled to detect any improvement, three consecutive months of solid employment growth have begun to lift the mood of consumers and the unemployed.
